text.1: the great priest born who knows the clouds abider with men is seated in the lap of waters.
text.2: worshipping seeking him with adoration like some lost creature followed by its footprints.
text.3: wise bhṛgus yearning in their hearts pursued him and found him lurking where the floods are gathered.
text.4: on the cows forehead with laborious searching trita the offspring of vibhiavas found him.
text.5: born in our houses youthful joybestower he now becomes the central point of brightness.
text.6: yearning with homage they have set and made him blithe priest among mankind oblationbearer.
text.7: leader of rites and purifier envoy of men as sacrifice that still advances.
text.8: the foolish brought the neerbewildered forward great victor songinspirer fortdestroyer.
text.9: leading the youth goldbearded like a courser gleaming with wealth they turned their hymn to profit.
text.10: holding his station firmly in the houses trita sat down within his home surrounded.
text.11: thence as law bids departs the tribes companion having collected men with no compulsion.
text.12: his are the fires eternal purifying that make the houses move whose smoke is shining.
text.13: white waxing in their strength for ever stirring and sitting in the wood like winds are somas.
text.14: the tongue of agni bears away the praisesong and through his care for earth her operations.
text.15: him bright and radiant living men have stablished as their blithe priest the chief of sacrificers.
text.16: that agni him whom heaven and earth engendered the waters tvaṣṭar and with might the bhṛgus.
text.17: him mātariśvan and the gods have fashioned holy for man and first to be entreated.
text.18: agni whom gods have made oblationbearer and muchdesiring men regard as holy.
text.19: give life to him who lauds thee when he worships and then shall glorious men in troops adore thee.
